program.name: lftp
program.configure:
case "${SB_SYSTYPE}" in *-aix6.1*) # -O2 triggers a bug in xlC when linking lftp CC=xlc CFLAGS="-O2 -qro -qroconst -qmaxmem=-1 -qarch=ppc" CXX=xlC CXXFLAGS="-O1 -qobjmodel=ibm -qro -qroconst \ -qnotempinc -qnotemplateregistry -qmaxmem=-1 -qarch=ppc" CC_LD_RT="-Wl,-blibpath:" LDFLAGS="-Wl,-brtl -Wl,-blibpath:/usr/lib" ;; *-aix*) CC=xlc CFLAGS="-O2 -qro -qroconst -qmaxmem=-1 -qarch=ppc" CXX=xlC CXXFLAGS="-O2 -qobjmodel=ibm -qro -qroconst \ -qnotempinc -qnotemplateregistry -qmaxmem=-1 -qarch=ppc" CC_LD_RT="-Wl,-blibpath:" LDFLAGS="-Wl,-brtl -Wl,-blibpath:/usr/lib" ;; ia64*-hpux11.23) CC=cc CFLAGS="-z +O2 +Ofltacc +Olit=all +Oentrysched \ +Odataprefetch +Onolimit" CXX=aCC CXXFLAGS="-D_HPUX_SOURCE -z +O2 +Ofltacc +Olit=all \ +Oentrysched +Odataprefetch +Onolimit" CC_LD_RT="-Wl,+b,"
# strtoull isn't available to C++ so use gnulib replacement export ac_cv_func_strtoll=no export ac_cv_func_strtoull=no ;; ia64*-hpux*) CC=cc CFLAGS="-z +O2 +Ofltacc +Olit=all +Oentrysched \ +Odataprefetch +Onolimit" CXX=aCC CXXFLAGS="-D_HPUX_SOURCE -z +O2 +Ofltacc +Olit=all \ +Oentrysched +Odataprefetch +Onolimit" CC_LD_RT="-Wl,+b," ;; *-hpux11.23) CC=cc CFLAGS="-z +O2 +Ofltacc +Olit=all +Oentrysched \ +Odataprefetch +Onolimit" CXX=aCC CXXFLAGS="-D_HPUX_SOURCE -AA -z +O2 +Ofltacc +Olit=all \ +Oentrysched +Odataprefetch +Onolimit" CC_LD_RT="-Wl,+s,+b,"
# strtoull isn't available to C++ so use gnulib replacement export ac_cv_func_strtoll=no export ac_cv_func_strtoull=no ;; *-hpux*) CC=cc CFLAGS="-z +O2 +Ofltacc +Olit=all +DAportable \ +Oentrysched +Odataprefetch +Onolimit" CXX=aCC CXXFLAGS="-D_HPUX_SOURCE -AA -z +O2 +Ofltacc +Olit=all \ +DAportable +Oentrysched +Odataprefetch +Onolimit" CC_LD_RT="-Wl,+s,+b," ;; *-irix*) CC_LD_RT="-Wl,-rpath,"
# otherwise our C decls clash with the system C++ std:: decls export ac_cv_have_decl_strtoll=yes
# strtoull isn't available to C++ so use gnulib replacement export ac_cv_func_strtoull=no ;; i?86*-linux*) CFLAGS="-O2 -mtune=pentiumpro -march=pentiumpro" CXXFLAGS="-O2 -mtune=pentiumpro -march=pentiumpro" CC_LD_RT="-Wl,-rpath," ;; *-linux*) CC_LD_RT="-Wl,-rpath," ;; *-osf*) CC=cc CFLAGS="-O2 -arch ev5 -nodtk -ieee -msym -readonly_strings" CXX=cxx CXXFLAGS="-D_BSD -O2 -arch ev5 -model ansi -ieee -msym \ -readonly_strings -timplicit_local" CC_LD_RT="-Wl,-rpath," ;; i?86*-solaris*) CFLAGS="-O2 -mtune=pentium4 -march=pentium4" CXXFLAGS="-O2 -mtune=pentium4 -march=pentium4" CC_LD_RT="-R" ;; *-solaris*) CFLAGS="-O2 -mcpu=ultrasparc -mvis" CXXFLAGS="-O2 -mcpu=ultrasparc -mvis" CC_LD_RT="-R" ;; esac
${SHELL} ./configure CPPFLAGS="${CPPFLAGS+${CPPFLAGS}} \ ${SB_VAR_READLINE+-I${SB_VAR_READLINE_INC}} \ ${SB_VAR_NCURSES+-I${SB_VAR_NCURSES_INC}} \ ${SB_VAR_LIBEXPAT+-I${SB_VAR_LIBEXPAT_INC}} \ ${SB_VAR_GETTEXT+-I${SB_VAR_GETTEXT_INC}} \ ${SB_VAR_LIBICONV+-I${SB_VAR_LIBICONV_INC}}" \ CC="${CC:-gcc}" CFLAGS="${CFLAGS:--O2}" \ CXX="${CXX:-g++}" CXXFLAGS="${CXXFLAGS:--O2} \ ${SB_VAR_READLINE+-I${SB_VAR_READLINE_INC}} \ ${SB_VAR_NCURSES+-I${SB_VAR_NCURSES_INC}}" \ LDFLAGS="\ ${SB_VAR_READLINE+-L${SB_VAR_READLINE_LIB}} \ ${SB_VAR_NCURSES+-L${SB_VAR_NCURSES_LIB}} \ ${SB_VAR_LIBEXPAT+-L${SB_VAR_LIBEXPAT_LIB}} \ ${SB_VAR_GETTEXT+-L${SB_VAR_GETTEXT_LIB}} \ ${SB_VAR_LIBICONV+-L${SB_VAR_LIBICONV_LIB}} \ ${SB_VAR_GCC_RT+-L${SB_VAR_GCC_RT_LIB}} \ ${SB_VAR_READLINE+${CC_LD_RT}${SB_VAR_READLINE_LIB}} \ ${SB_VAR_NCURSES+${CC_LD_RT}${SB_VAR_NCURSES_LIB}} \ ${SB_VAR_LIBEXPAT+${CC_LD_RT}${SB_VAR_LIBEXPAT_LIB}} \ ${SB_VAR_GETTEXT+${CC_LD_RT}${SB_VAR_GETTEXT_LIB}} \ ${SB_VAR_LIBICONV+${CC_LD_RT}${SB_VAR_LIBICONV_LIB}} \ ${SB_VAR_GCC_RT+${CC_LD_RT}${SB_VAR_GCC_RT_LIB}} \ ${LDFLAGS+${LDFLAGS}}" \ PKG_CONFIG_PATH="${SB_VAR_GNUTLS_LIB}/pkgconfig" \ --enable-static --mandir=${SB_INSTALL_PREFIX}/man \ --datadir=${_datadir} --sysconfdir=${_sysconfdir} \ --disable-dependency-tracking ${ARGS+${ARGS}} \ --prefix=${SB_INSTALL_PREFIX} \ ac_cv_search_tigetstr=-lncurses
# lftpget should use absolute path to lftp ${SB_PATH_SED} -i -e "\ s! lftp ! ${SB_INSTALL_PREFIX}/bin/lftp !;" src/lftpget
# fix path to Perl ${SB_PATH_SED} -i -e "\ 1s|.*|#!${SB_VAR_PERL}/bin/perl|;" \ src/convert-netscape-cookies src/verify-file
# path to curl ca-bundle.crt ${SB_PATH_SED} -i -e "\ s!@CURL_DATADIR@!${_curl_datadir}!;" src/lftp_ssl.cc

Apply patch for CVE-2010-2251 (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-2251). The get1 command, as used by lftpget, does not properly validate a server-provided filename before determining the destination filename of a download, which allows remote servers to create or overwrite arbitrary files via a Content-Disposition header that suggests a crafted filename, and possibly execute arbitrary code as a consequence of writing to a dotfile in a home directory.
